text: Psalm 91
God’s Protection in Times of Crisis
\add One who\add* lives in the secret place\f + \fr 91:1 \ft Or “shelter” \f* of the Most High
will lodge in the shadow of Shaddai.\f + \fr 91:1 \ft Often translated “the Almighty,” this is perhaps better understood as “\fq God of the \ft Mountain” \f*
I will say to Yahweh, “\add You are\add* my refuge and my fortress,
my God \add in whom\add* I trust.”
For he will deliver\f + \fr 91:3 \ft Hebrew “he, he will deliver” is perhaps emphatic, “He will certainly deliver” \f* you from \add the\add* snare of \add the\add* fowler,
from \add the\add* plague of destruction.
With his feathers he will cover you,
and under his wings you can take refuge.
His faithfulness \add will be\add* a shield and a buckler.\f + \fr 91:4 \ft That is, a small, round shield, or perhaps a surrounding bulwark \f*
You need not fear \add the\add* terror of \add the\add* night,
\add or the\add* arrow \add that\add* flies by day,
\add or the\add* plague \add that\add* spreads in the darkness,
\add or the\add* destruction \add that\add* devastates at noon.
A thousand may fall at your side,
and ten thousand at your right \add hand\add*,
\add but\add* it will not come near you.
You will only look with your eyes,
and see \add the\add* punishment of \add the\add* wicked.
For you, O Yahweh, \add are\add* my refuge.

You have made the Most High your dwelling place.\f + \fr 91:9 \ft This is the most straightforward translation of the Hebrew, though the “you” of each line would refer to a different person. A more unusual rendering would be “Because Yahweh, my refuge, even the Most High, you have made your dwelling place …” \f*
No harm will befall you,
and no plague will come near your tent.
For he will command his angels concerning you,
to watch over you in all your ways.
In \add their\add* hands they will bear you up,
lest you strike your foot against a stone.
You will tread on lion and viper;
you will trample young lion and serpent.
Because he loves me, therefore I will deliver him;
I will protect\f + \fr 91:14 \ft The sense is that of making something inaccessibly high, like a fortress \f* him because he knows my name.
He will call upon me and I will answer him;
I \add will be\add* with him in trouble;
I will rescue and honor him.
\add With\add* ⸤long life⸥\f + \fr 91:16 \ft Literally “a length of days” \f* I will satisfy him,
and show him my salvation.
